title: Python How-To
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101055129/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : ["How To" Section](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101055129/http:/typophile.com/wiki/How-To) : Scripting with Python**

Before you get started making macro programs for [FontLab](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101055129/http:/typophile.com/wiki/FontLab), you must download and install [Python](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101055129/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Python), the programming language that is used by FontLab to write macros. You can download Python from [www.python.org](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101055129/http:/www.python.org/ "www.python.org").

First you should begin by reading the chapter entitled "Macro Programming" in the FontLab Users' Manual, which can be downloaded from the following locations:  
**Windows:** [US](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101055129/http:/www.font.to/downloads/manuals/FLS5WinManual.zip) : [Europe](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101055129/http:/www.fontlab.ch/downloads/manuals/FLS5WinManual.zip) (.zip)  
**Mac:** [US](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101055129/http:/www.font.to/downloads/manuals/FLS5MacManual.zip) : [Europe](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101055129/http:/www.fontlab.ch/downloads/manuals/FLS5MacManual.zip) : [Asia](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101055129/http:/www.fontlab.hk/downloads/manuals/FLS5MacManual.zip) (.zip)

Once you have done that, some great resources to start with:  
 [The Unofficial FontLab/Python API Reference](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101055129/http:/dev.fontlab.net/flpydoc/)  
 [The Letterror FontLab Scripting Mailing List Archives](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101055129/http:/mail.letterror.com/pipermail/fontlab-scripting/)
